metadata.name: Upstream
metadata.description:
'Upstream'  
River Itchen, Hampshire, England

Artist - Michael Hartley

A winter's day by the beautiful River Itchen in Hampshire. An evergreen ivy has reached down from a dormant tree, meeting the cold, slow-flowing water.

It is one of only 200 chalk streams in the world, and a site of special scientific interest. There's a chance to spot kingfishers, otters, trout, Atlantic salmon, and white-clawed crayfish.


Michael Hartley - A photo artist living on the South Coast of England. A passion for exploring coastlines, and ancient forests, creating in response to nature. Processing in black and white, often in a minimalist, spacious style (2022)

Date Taken - 24th February 2017 - 13:39  
Location - 51.001646, -1.326528  
Edition - 1/1  
Camera - Nikon D5500  
Lens - Sigma 17-50mm  
Capture Settings - 29mm, 1/50 of a second at f/8 and ISO 100, hand held

License - Can be used to display privately, or in commercial and non-commercial settings, or in groups with an unlimited number of participants. The license includes unlimited use and display in virtual or physical galleries, documentaries, and essays by the NFT holder. Provides no rights to create commercial merchandise, commercial distribution, or derivative works. Copyright remains with artist.

Declaration - The image (Upstream) will never be replicated as an edition, in a collection, composite, or in any form of digital art.
